item.name: Role Permission
üìã Permissions

request.description: Retrieve all permissions for the authenticated user's organization. Supports filtering by category, resource, scope, and status.
Retrieve a specific permission by its ID. Returns detailed information including relationships and computed fields.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Delete Users",
  "code": "delete_users",
  "display_name": "Delete Users",
  "description": "Allow users to delete other user accounts",
  "resource": "users",
  "action": "delete",
  "scope": "organization",
  "category": "user_management",
  "is_dangerous": true,
  "requires_approval": true,
  "sort_order": 100,
  "is_visible": true
}

request.description: Create a new permission. All fields are validated and the permission is automatically assigned to the current organization.
Update an existing permission. System permissions cannot be modified. Only non-system permissions can be updated.
Delete a permission. System permissions and permissions assigned to roles cannot be deleted.

item.description: Core CRUD operations for managing permissions within an organization.

item.name: üìÅ Permission Groups

request.description: Retrieve all permission groups for the organization. Includes hierarchical structure and permission counts.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "User Management",
  "code": "user_management",
  "display_name": "User Management",
  "description": "Permissions related to user management operations",
  "category": "administration",
  "parent_group_id": null,
  "icon": "users",
  "color": "#3B82F6",
  "sort_order": 10,
  "permission_ids": ["{{permission_id_1}}", "{{permission_id_2}}"]
}

request.description: Create a new permission group. Can optionally include permissions and have a parent group for hierarchical organization.

item.description: Manage permission groups for better organization and categorization of permissions.

item.name: üë• Role Permissions

request.description: Retrieve all permissions assigned to a specific role. Shows granted permissions with their details.
Assign multiple permissions to a role. This will replace all existing permissions for the role with the new set.
Remove specific permissions from a role. Only the specified permissions will be removed.

item.description: Manage permission assignments to roles for effective access control.

item.name: üë§ User Permissions

request.description: Retrieve all permissions for the currently authenticated user. Shows effective permissions from all assigned roles.
Check if the current user has a specific permission. Useful for frontend permission checks and conditional UI rendering.

item.description: User-specific permission operations for checking access rights and retrieving user permissions.

request.description: Get paginated list of roles with filters and search. Requires 'roles.view' permission.
Get specific role details with users and permissions. Requires 'roles.view' permission.

body.raw:
{
    "name": "Senior Developer",
    "code": "senior_developer",
    "display_name": "Senior Developer",
    "description": "Senior level developer role with advanced permissions",
    "level": 5,
    "scope": "organization",
    "is_active": true,
    "is_system_role": false,
    "permission_ids": [1, 2, 3],
    "metadata": {
        "department": "Engineering",
        "experience_level": "Senior"
    }
}

request.description:
Create a new role. Requires 'roles.create' permission.

Required fields:
- name: Role name (unique)
- code: Role code (unique, lowercase with underscores)
- display_name: Display name
- level: Role level (1-100)
- scope: Role scope (global, organization, department, team, personal)

Optional fields:
- description: Role description
- is_active: Whether role is active
- is_system_role: Whether it's a system role
- permission_ids: Array of permission IDs
- metadata: Additional metadata

body.raw:
{
    "name": "Updated Senior Developer",
    "code": "updated_senior_developer",
    "display_name": "Updated Senior Developer",
    "description": "Updated description for senior developer role",
    "level": 6,
    "scope": "organization",
    "is_active": true,
    "permission_ids": [1, 2, 3, 4],
    "metadata": {
        "department": "Engineering",
        "experience_level": "Senior",
        "updated_at": "2024-01-15"
    }
}

request.description:
Update an existing role. Requires 'roles.update' permission.

All fields are optional for updates:
- name: Role name (unique)
- code: Role code (unique, lowercase with underscores)
- display_name: Display name
- description: Role description
- level: Role level (1-100)
- scope: Role scope (global, organization, department, team, personal)
- is_active: Whether role is active
- permission_ids: Array of permission IDs
- metadata: Additional metadata
Delete a role. Requires 'roles.delete' permission.
Get available roles for assignment (non-system roles, non-global scope). Requires 'roles.view' permission.
Get role statistics including total roles, system roles, custom roles, etc. Requires 'roles.view' permission.
Get all users assigned to a specific role. Requires 'roles.view' permission.

Assign a role to a user. Requires 'roles.assign' permission.

Required fields:
- user_id: ID of the user
- role_id: ID of the role to assign

Revoke a role from a user. Requires 'roles.revoke' permission.

Required fields:
- user_id: ID of the user
- role_id: ID of the role to revoke

item.description: Complete permission management system including CRUD operations, grouping, role assignments, and user permission checks.

body.raw:
{ "category_id": "{{category_id}}", "title": "Getting Started with Laravel", "description": "A comprehensive guide to getting started with Laravel framework", "content_type": "article", "content": "

Getting Started with Laravel

Laravel is a web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax...

", "summary": "Learn the basics of Laravel framework and build your first application", "excerpt": "Complete guide to Laravel framework", "tags": ["laravel", "php", "framework", "web-development"], "keywords": ["laravel", "php", "framework", "tutorial"], "language": "english", "difficulty_level": "intermediate", "priority": "medium", "estimated_read_time": 15, "meta_title": "Getting Started with Laravel - Complete Guide", "meta_description": "Learn Laravel framework from scratch with this comprehensive guide", "featured_image_url": "https://example.com/images/laravel-guide.jpg", "is_featured": false, "is_public": true, "is_searchable": true, "is_ai_trainable": true, "requires_approval": true, "workflow_status": "draft", "approval_status": "pending", "qa_items": [ { "question": "What is Laravel?", "answer": "Laravel is a free, open-source PHP web framework used for building web applications.", "question_variations": ["Tell me about Laravel", "What is the Laravel framework?"], "answer_variations": ["Laravel is a PHP framework for web development.", "It's a modern PHP framework."], "context": "Framework introduction", "intent": "information", "confidence_level": "high", "keywords": ["laravel", "framework", "php"], "search_keywords": ["laravel", "framework", "php", "web"], "trigger_phrases": ["what is", "tell me about", "explain"], "order_index": 1, "is_primary": true, "is_active": true } ] }
